intro: Camissonia scapoidea var. utahensis, commonly known as the Utah filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as slopes and dry meadows. The plant is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
